fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Our obituary of Lord Hutchinson of Lullington, the renowned barrister, described one of his former clients, George Blake, as an “atom spy”. Blake betrayed a number of western intelligence operations to the Soviet Union, but not nuclear secrets. Also, Hutchinson joined the House of Lords in 1978, not 1979, and the year of the split in which four Labour MPs left to found the Social Democratic party was not 1979 but 1981 (15 November, page 33). • Readers saw a repeat offender when an article referred to “a bacteria”. Bacterium is the singular of bacteria (Acid reflux drug linked to stomach cancer risk, 1 November, page 16).
